subject: RE: [junit] Where to place test classes?
msgSnippet: I see your point.  I guess it implies enough for practicle purposes as long as you expend that to package level and protected methods also.  However, it
messageBody:
I see your point. I guess it implies enough for
practicle purposes as long as you expend that to
package level and protected methods also. However, it
doesn't guarantee 100% they work though. I guess that
I feel in theory every method should have a test.


--- "STRAYER, JON (AIT)" <jon.strayer@...> wrote:
> > Thanks for the info. I like this approach,
> because it
> > still allows us to test protected methods. I also
> > like that the test packages are identical to the
> > production packages.
> >
> > Does anyone have experience using inner classes
> and
> > JUnit in order to test private methods?
>
> If your public methods work, doesn't that imply that
> the private/protected
> methods also work?
>


=====
Best Regards,
Cornellious Mann
